explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA C Rule 2.2 targets ‘‘dead code’’ in the sense of executed operations whose removal would not affect program behaviour. The cast-to-void idiom here ((void) kind; (void) filename; (void) content_type; (void) transfer_encoding;) is the conventional, documented way to indicate an intentionally unused parameter and to suppress compiler warnings; it has no runtime side‑effects and is not considered code that changes program behaviour. In particular: (a) removing those statements does not change the program semantics (only potentially diagnostics), and (b) MISRA guidance treats the unused-parameter suppression idiom differently from unwanted executable dead code. If the parameter were volatile or its evaluation had side effects then the expression would matter, but that is not the case here. Therefore Agent A’s claim that the (void) transfer_encoding; line violates Rule 2.2 is incorrect.
